Question: What rule should you use to judge a safe following distance in wet or frosty conditions if driving a car?
What must be displayed on the back of a trailer being towed at night?
If you have to drive at a slow speed which may hold up other vehicles, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
Make the traffic behind you slow down to the speed that you are driving at
Drive down the middle of the road so that any vehicles behind you can pass on the left

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
If you have had a flat tyre and have fitted a ‘space saver wheel’ what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive directly to a place where the flat tyre can be repaired and replaced
Drive at 40km/h until the flat tyre has been repaired
Lower the pressure in the other tyres

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What should you do when another vehicle is following you very closely?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get further ahead
Flick your vehicle lights and wave your arm
Slow down, move to the left and allow the vehicle to pass

Question: What must you do when you come up to a red light showing at traffic signals?

Answers.Answer: Stop and then go on carefully
Go on slowly if no other traffic is coming
Stop only if other vehicles are coming from the right
Stop and wait until it changes to a green light

Question: What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?
If you have a front tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a Stop sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

Question: You may use a right turn bay to overtake a vehicle travelling straight ahead.
If you are going straight through a roundabout don’t signal as you come up to the roundabout, only signal left as you pass the exit before the one you wish to take.
When should you use the fog lights on your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are in a hurry during the day
When you are coming up to an airport at night
When there is no fog but you want other drivers to see you
When you cannot see because of foggy conditions

Question: Directions from a police officer overrule traffic signals, road signs and give way rules at an intersection.
What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may stop for no more than 5 minutes

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are waiting at a railway level crossing and the red lights continue to flash after the train has passed. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on carefully while the lights are still flashing
Stay stopped until the lights stop flashing
Check both ways and then drive on
Wait for 15 seconds and then drive on

Question: When coming up to a one-lane bridge, what does this sign indicate?

Answers.Answer: Others should give way to you

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top right corner of the windscreen

Question: If you have a restricted licence you can carry a passenger if they are your spouse.

Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
When are you allowed to pass another vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are coming up to a blind corner or blind bend
When a vehicle has stopped at a pedestrian crossing
When you can see at least 100 metres of clear road in front of you once you have finished passing
When you are less than 10 metres away from a railway level crossing

Question: If you are turning left at an intersection, you must give way to vehicles coming towards you that are turning right.
What is the speed limit from the time you pass an Accident sign until you are past the crash site?
What is the minimum tread depth required for car tyres?
To tow a trailer on a restricted driver licence, the weight of your vehicle plus the weight of the trailer and its load must not exceed what weight?
You are driving on a country road at night when your vehicle headlights suddenly go out. What is the safest thing to do?

Answers.Answer: Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle hazard lights on
Slow down and drive on the far left side of the road
Carry on driving to the nearest garage with your vehicle’s interior lights on
Slow down, move off the road gradually, stop and turn your vehicle hazard lights on
